definitions.definition: To shrivel, droop or dry up, especially from lack of water.
To cause to shrivel or dry up.
To lose vigour or power; to languish; to pass away.
To become helpless due to emotion.
To make helpless due to emotion.
The process by which something withers.
Tending to destroy, devastate, overwhelm or cause complete destruction.
definitions.example: The D-Day troops came under withering fire.
The playboy seemed oblivious to his withering fortune as he continued in his decadent lifestyle.

definitions.definition: Tending to make someone feel small; scornful in a mortifying way.
definitions.example: He made withering remarks about his adversary.
